OSINT Advent Calendar: Part 3

Day 9 to 12 of the OSINT For Fun Advent Calendar 2025

OSINT For Fun Advent calendar: part 3

Spoiler alert: solution ahead

OSINT for Fun has a great number of challenges on their website. Each challenge is usually faster to complete than the Bellingcat ones, so that's why I do multiple at a time.
You might notice that the progress seems slow. This is because writing it up takes much longer than completing the challenges.

This post, I'm going to show how I solved the challenges of day 9 through 12.

Day 9

Who said statues couldn't move?!

We can hear a song. I could've Shazammed the song, but instead I Googled this sentence which one can hear: "I first set my eyes on sweet Molly Malone". I instantly knew that this challenge was going to be about the Molly Malone statue, located in Dublin. For context, I saw it as a tourist back in 2017.

The challenge description mentions that the statue was moved, so first we need to find its original location. The Wikipedia page for the statue mentions that it was placed at the bottom of Grafton Street, and that the statue was moved in April 2014.

Great! Now we need to see if there's some way to see what it looked like. And Google Maps, very conveniently, can help us out here!

By going to the North-end of Grafton Street in Google Street View and changing the date to June 2009, we can see the statue in its old location.

We can see that the statue faces a pediment that says IRISH PERMANENT. Day 9 done!

Day 10

African answers

This challenge is a bit more serious. Find the park where 19 rhinos were poached.

First, I started to Google, simply typing: 19 rhinos killed december 2024. The first hit contained the answer: Kruger National Park.

That's the first part of the challenge. Next, I was asked to find out how many rhinos were killed in 2017 and 2023 in the province with the most killings.

The first step is to figure out what province we need to look into. This was once again performed by a simple Google search.

Clearly, it's KwaZulu-Natal which sees the most rhino killings in South Africa. Next, I needed to find the number of killed rhinos in 2017. I used the following Google query to find the answer on Save the Rhino International's webpage: rhino killings 2017 kwazulu natal. In 2017, 222 rhinos were poached.

Next, I needed to find the number of rhinos killed in 2023. I simply altered the query by replacing "2017" with "2023" and clicked on the first two hits. Both showed the same answer, namely that an estimated 325 rhinos were killed.

The answer to the question is thus 222 325.

Day 11

My lucky day

Time to hit Google once again. Time to find some old German lotto results! First, I used Google Translate before searching, as searching in the original language usually has a greater chance of success in my experience.

I ended up with the following text: Nur ungerade Zahlen der Lotterie von 1988. When queried, the second hit looked very promising.

Scrolling down on this page we find our answer: 3 21 23 25 27 47.

And to my surprise, another question appeared.

This should not be too hard to find either.

The Polish actor was quickly identified as Szymon Piotr Warszawski.

In the same results, there is a link to his Wikipedia page (in Polish), where he is seen with a race bib.

When I clicked on the image, I noticed that the original source of the image linked to a Flickr.com page. This page has indeed this picture, but also other pictures from the event. And by moving two images to the left, I found a man wearing a shirt with the event name clearly visible.

I Googled just to make sure that the text on the bib is really the name of the race, and that was indeed the case. I can say that the actor participated in the Bieg po Nowe Å»ycie race.

Day 12

That place works!

This was a fun challenge, and I'm glad they are getting more difficult as the days progress.

For this challenge, first, I need to know the company name. The image provided has all the company names removed, as well as the street name. But they didn't make it impossible to solve.

My initial plan of attack consisted of reverse-searching the provided image. However, it became apparent that this would not work, or if it did, I was not patient enough.

So, I went for my usual plan B: when in doubt, dork it out. I figured that if I just search for one of the slogans which are visible next to the entrance, I might find the company. And so, I did!

I ended up on a PDF that included the exact same slogan, and the company name and website. The logo matched the blurred logo in the challenge-description, so I was confident I was going in the right direction.

Visiting their website, we can see that they have three different offices. I picked the office in Toulouse, based on the reflection in the store windows. Then, I looked the location up on Google Maps and went into Street View. I needed to change the date to 2021 to get a good view of the shop next door.

Now, as the last step I simply typed the phone number into Google, and the first hit shows us the answer.

To conclude: the company's legal name is M.V! That's all for this post, I'll be back later to solve some more challenges in the next one.
